github.lightningcreations.lcjei.service

Interface JEIServiceProvider<GameType>

  • Type Parameters:
    GameType - The type of games used by the underlying provider

    public interface JEIServiceProvider<GameType>
    Provider type for the JaveEngineInterface
    Author:
    chorm

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Optional<IEngineInterface<GameType>> getActiveEngineInterface()
      If there is an active engine of this type, returns an optional containing an interface to that engine.
      java.lang.String getEngineName()
      Returns the name of the Engine.
      java.lang.Class<GameType> getGameClass()
      Runtime mapping of GameType.
      If GameType is com.example.ExampleClass, then returns com.example.ExampleClass.class.
      IEngineInterface<GameType> newEngine(GameType game)
      Returns a new engine interface that will start with game, in an uninitialized state.
      This method may check an unspecified permission with the System or some other unspecified SecurityManager.

    • Method Detail

      • getGameClass

        java.lang.Class<GameType> getGameClass()
        Runtime mapping of GameType.
        If GameType is com.example.ExampleClass, then returns com.example.ExampleClass.class.

      • getEngineName

        java.lang.String getEngineName()
        Returns the name of the Engine.

      • newEngine

        IEngineInterface<GameType> newEngine(GameType game)
        Returns a new engine interface that will start with game, in an uninitialized state.
        This method may check an unspecified permission with the System or some other unspecified SecurityManager. This can result in an SecurityException being thrown.

      • getActiveEngineInterface

        java.util.Optional<IEngineInterface<GameType>> getActiveEngineInterface()
        If there is an active engine of this type, returns an optional containing an interface to that engine. Otherwise returns an empty optional.
        If this Service Provider does not support this method, an UnsupportedOperationException is thrown.
        This method may check an unspecified permission with the System or some other unspecified SecurityManager. This can result in an SecurityException being thrown.
        Even if the active engine does not change, return values of this method are not required to compare equal. Do not rely on this behavior in any case.
        If there is a returned engine, then it is in an unspecified state. If there are multiple active engines for this engine type, the one for which an interface is returned is unspecified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this provider does not support obtaining an interface to an active engine.
